mdRecord.dcterms:title: Carrel 4-4, southwest wall
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Donohue, Liam Patrick [photographer]
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Expressions of despair and love sickness. Discussion of Yates yet again. Comments on a capella groups and football at UVA, with responses. Doodle of a snake in a boot (corresponding to graffiti visible in next image referring to Woody from the film Toy Story, who has the line 'There's a snake in my boot'). Doodle of a pig and mention of swine flu. [work]
Student graffiti art and messages inscribed on carrel walls in the new stacks, Alderman Library, University of Virginia, prior to the renovation of the building, 2020-2023. [host]

I wanna die | I miss my bae :( | Yat-e-s Is GAY | ^e ↓ does it matter? He writes better than you | SO Right → Why do A Capella groups write shit on walls? You all are mildly entertaining the first time you perform -- the day 1st years move in and don't know what to do at night. But beyond that... ←How I feel about VA football → retweet | SWINE FLU WUZ HERE
